Dialogue.Page: Hi, astronaut!
You know the patch of ghost matter inside this fence? Gossan said it used to be bigger when they were a hatchling. ’Cause ghost matter evaporates.
It just takes a su-<Pause=0.4>u-<Pause=0.4>u-<Pause=0.4>per long time to go away.
I hope there’s still ghost matter in the village when I’m a grown-up.
Ghost matter is awesome! I wanna learn all about it someday when I become an astronaut.

DialogueOption.Text: Hey, Arkose. Wanna learn something cool about ghost matter?
Ghost matter is super cool. It’ll burn the heck out of you!
You shouldn’t be throwing rocks in there — ghost matter is dangerous.
You know ghost matter is how Tektite lost their foot, right?

Dialogue.Page: Something cool? Tell me, tell me!

DialogueOption.Text: Marshmallows taste better if you use a stick to dip 'em in ghost matter.
Ghost matter killed the Noma-Iiii shouldn't be telling you this, never mind.
Ghost matter becomes safe for a moment when it's submerged in water.
Ghost matter obeys gravity, like from planets and gravity crystals!
Ghost matter doesn't evaporate on its own. It's actually the plants and trees that are absorbing it slowly.
Nevermind. I'll uh, tell you when I get back from space.

Dialogue.Page: What? Really?!
I'm SO gonna try that later! I'll open a brand new can of yummy mallows to try this!
Wait, but I'll need to bring them down to the campfire to cook them.. Can't eat 'em otherwise... I'll dip all of 'em here first - then bring it all down to cook and share them with Teph and Galena!

DialogueOption.Text: Wait I was kidding please don't. I'm not sure what might happen - you three might get a really bad stomachache, or way, way worse!

Dialogue.Page: But.. Porphy said an iron stomach is what makes a true Hearthian!
Porphy won't let us try sap wine, so maybe if we eat a mallow dipped in ghost matter, it'll make our insides strong enough to digest sap wine!
Ugh, but what if it hurts really, really bad eating it..? What if my insides can't defeat the ghost matter?
..I'm gonna throw some more rocks while I think about this.
Wait, what'd you say? Did ghost matter um.. <Pause>hurt somebody in the village really badly?

DialogueOption.Text: Ghost matter hurt.. someone really close to me. Just promise me you'll be careful.
There was a race of ancient aliens who lived in our star system who... left after ghost matter appeared in the star system, because they realized it was dangerous to be around it.

Dialogue.Page: Oh..
Does that um.. have to do with why you visit the graveyard every now and then, astronaut..?
Um, I promise I'll be careful, astronaut! You don't have to worry about me. <Pause>But when I'm older.. maybe you can tell me what happened?
Don't look so sad.. By the time I'm all grown up, all the ghost matter will probably have evaporated, and then the whole village will be safe for everyone!
Woah.. Is that true?
They must have been really, really smart to figure that out and leave the star system! I hope they're doing okay, wherever they are now.
Hey, we should send a message to tell them that the star system's mostly safe now! Then they can move back here to this star system - and we can talk and eat mallows around the campfire together!
That's.. really, really weird! Only as long as it's submerged? How'd you figure this out, astronaut?
Huh, so that means if we wore like.. a suit of water, we could walk into the ghost matter just fine, and make snow angels in it!
Yeah! I'm gonna go ask Slate to build me a suit of water for this. I'm sure he'll understand!
Huh, really?!
So you're telling me if um.. somebody borrowed the crystal from the museum and pointed it near the ghost matter, I could order the ghost matter to go where I wanted it with its gravity?
That's. SO. Cool..!! Yay, I'm gonna be able to shoot ghost matter at any mean bugs that fly at me! Pew pew pew!
Thanks a bunch for telling me, astronaut!
Oh. That's good to know!
I bet that big, scary plant planet Chert told us about has no ghost matter at all then, since it's a big mean plant. It's probably eaten up any ghost matter on it!
If I ever become an astronaut, I'm gonna hunt for patches of ghost matter all over the star system.
..And that means I'm never going to that creepy planet. Blegh! No dank, dangerous ghost matter? It'd be way too safe and boring to explore!
You're back, astronaut! You promised to tell me something cool about ghost matter, didn't you? Can I hear about the ghost matter secrets yet? Pleease?

DialogueOption.Text: Alright, alright. Did you know marshmallows taste better if you dip them in ghost matter?
Ghost matter killed the Noma-Iiii shouldn't be telling you this, never mind.
Ghost matter becomes safe for a moment when it's submerged in water.
Ghost matter obeys gravity, like from planets and gravity crystals!
Ghost matter doesn't evaporate on its own. It's actually the plants and trees that are absorbing it slowly.
Sorry, Arkose. Maybe another time.

Dialogue.Page: Aw.. Okay..
Yeah! I heard touching it hurts so bad it feels like your whole hand’s on fire!
Try not to walk into any in space, okay? That sounds bad and painful.
Uhhh, obviously? That’s what makes it so awesome? Geez, I’m not dumb enough to touch it.
Ugh, you’re such a grown-up.
Whoa, really?! ...That is so cool!
It’s cool that Little Scouts can detect ghost matter and all, but what would be really cool is if the Little Scout could, like, shoot ghost matter at stuff. All pew pew pew!

DialogueOption.Text: Hey, Arkose. Wanna learn something cool about ghost matter?
